unit: Unit 6 | Inference for Categorical Data: Proportions
title: Estimating Parameters: Margin of Error Calculation
question_text: A sociologist wishes to determine whether a significant difference exists in quality of life between people in urban and rural areas. A survey will be sent out to randomly selected people in rural and urban areas and ask, “Are you happy with your quality of life?” Assuming equal sample sizes and that no prior information is known, what is the minimum number of people in rural and urban areas that needs to be selected for a $95\%$ confidence interval (estimating the difference in happiness) to have a margin of error no more than $3\%$ ?
